Method Detail

getLogReportRecipient

protected abstract java.lang.String getLogReportRecipient()
Returns:
the e-mail address that will be used when submitting an error log message

getPreferences

protected final android.content.SharedPreferences getPreferences()
Returns:
the shared preferences of the application

getFrameworkVersionString

public static java.lang.String getFrameworkVersionString()
Returns:
the version of the framework the application is using

shouldBeSilent

protected boolean shouldBeSilent()
A callback method which enables to indicate whether the process newly created should use the usual workflow.

It is useful when having multiple processes for the same application, and that some of the processes should not use the framework.

Returns:
true if and only if you want the framework to be ignored for the process. Returns false by default

getActivityRedirector

protected ActivityController.Redirector getActivityRedirector()
It is ensured that the framework will only call once this method (unless you explicitly invoke it).

Returns:
an instance which indicates how to redirect activities if necessary. Returns null, which means that no redirection is handled by default ; override this method, in order to control the redirection mechanism

getActivityInterceptor

protected ActivityController.Interceptor getActivityInterceptor()
It is ensured that the framework will only call once this method (unless you explicitly invoke it).

Returns:
an instance which will be invoked on every Activity life-cycle event. Returns null, which means that no interception is handled by default ; override this method, in order to be notified of activities life-cycle events

getExceptionHandler

protected ActivityController.ExceptionHandler getExceptionHandler()
It is ensured that the framework will only call once this method (unless you explicitly invoke it).

Returns:
an instance which will be invoked when an exception occurs during the application, provided the exception is handled by the framework. Returns a ActivityController.AbstractExceptionHandler instance ; override this method, in order to handle more specifically some application-specific exceptions

getI18N

protected abstract SmartApplication.I18N getI18N()
This method will be invoked by the getExceptionHandler() method when building an ActivityController.AbstractExceptionHandler instance. This internationalization instance will be used to populate default dialog boxes texts popped-up by this default ActivityController.ExceptionHandler. Hence, the method will be invoked at the application start-up.

Returns:
an instance which contains the internationalized text strings for some built-in error dialog boxes. You need to define that method.

onCreate

public final void onCreate()
Overrides:
onCreate in class android.app.Application

getExternalStorageApplicationDirectory

protected final java.io.File getExternalStorageApplicationDirectory()
Returns:
the path of the directory on the SD card where the persistence can be stored

checkLicense

protected void checkLicense(android.app.Application application)

onCreateCustom

protected void onCreateCustom()
This method will be invoked at the end of the onCreate() method, once the framework initialization is over. You can override this method, which does nothing by default, in order to initialize your application specific variables, invoke some services.

Keep in mind that this method should complete very quickly, in order to prevent from hanging the GUI thread, and thus causing a bad end-user experience, and a potential ANR.

getLogLevel

protected int getLogLevel()
Returns:
the log level trigger of the application

onTerminate

public void onTerminate()
In addition to the default behavior, this event will be logged, and the SmartCommands.LOW_PRIORITY_THREAD_POOL and AppInternals.THREAD_POOL thread pools stopped.

Overrides:
onTerminate in class android.app.Application

onLowMemory

public void onLowMemory()
In addition to the default behavior, this event will be logged.

Specified by:
onLowMemory in interface android.content.ComponentCallbacks
Overrides:
onLowMemory in class android.app.Application
